title: Ticket #6372: "first-class" names for "+pre" or "+post" and company
description:
The naming for pre- and post- scripts is consistent but something of a mess, and we kind of think that "pre" and "post" are misleading in the vanilla universe anyway, since they aren't the first and last tasks in the shishkebab DAG (they won't be running in the same environment as the job proper).

We should consult with an RCF to see if we can do better. 

pseudo-BNF 
{Pre,Post}{Cmd,Args|Arguments,Env|Environment}
{Pre,Post}[Success]Exit{Code,BySignal,Signal}

Possibilities for new prefixes include:

  • transfer_input_files[_cmd], but that could easily be misunderstood
  • prepare_sandbox[_cmd] / check_sandbox[_cmd] are ambiguously ordered
  • PostSandboxPreJob[_cmd] and PostJobPreSandbox[_cmd] are unambiguous but hard to say easy to confuse
  • ValidateInputFiles[_cmd] and CheckOutputFiles[_cmd]
  • post_input[_cmd] and pre_output[_cmd]

It would be most consistent if all we did was change the prefix (and it would be easy to code).
remarks:
2017-Sep-12 10:59:33 by tlmiller:
The RCFs point out that what most of their users would want is actually a vanilla-universe pre- or post- script, not the horrible hack that we have now. There wasn't any particular consensus on what to call what we have now, but there was consensus on it not sounding particularly useful.

The consensus was that the shish-kebab/multiple command idea would be hard to explain.
